jobDescription: <strong>Start your exciting career journey here<br><br></strong>The Estée Lauder Companies offers unique development programs especially designed for undergraduate students. If you are a results-driven digital native with a passion for luxury beauty, The Estée Lauder Companies could be a valuable first step in your career journey.<br><br>We seek high-performers from all university levels to bring fresh perspectives to our teams. Our talent management team works diligently to set our interns and full-time professionals up for success. Business leaders are assigned to help students define business goals, develop their skillset, and guide them to make an impact from day one.<br><br><strong><u>What You Will Achieve<br></u></strong><ul><li> Invaluable exposure to the prestige beauty industry</li><li> Access to mentoring, coaching, learning and development opportunities</li><li> Building leadership skills</li><li> Gaining business insights and expanding capabilities to accelerate career development<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong><strong>What we are looking for <br></strong><ul><li> Penultimate or final year students in any discipline with outstanding academic records</li><li> No minimum work experience required, but with a passion for the beauty industry</li><li> Strong interpersonal, leadership, and presentation skills</li><li> Digital acumen</li><li> Motivated and innovative</li><li> Local work permit is required<br></li></ul><strong>Job</strong> Marketing<br><br><strong>Primary Location</strong> Asia Pacific-CN-HK-Yau Tsim Mong<br><br><strong>Job Type</strong> Standard<br><br><strong>Schedule</strong> Full-time<br><br><strong>Shift</strong> 1st (Day) Shift<br><br><strong>Job Number</strong> 2112144

<strong>Job Reference #<br></strong>240741BR<br><br><strong>Job Type<br></strong>Full Time<br><br><strong>Your role<br></strong>Are you motivated to work as part of a cross divisional function that will give you a clear insight into the overall top-down strategy and direction of our bank? Do you want to play a key role in defining and implementing that for UBS in APAC? Do you have a clear understanding of a specific business line in either the Investment Bank, Private Bank or Asset Management and how it operates, due to experience either in a similar position or from an external consulting perspective?<br><br>We are looking for someone to:<br><br><ul><li> Develop and support the implementation of our Group strategy in APAC as well as strategic sub-streams and thematic endeavors across markets and businesses, to maximize UBS cross-divisional opportunities</li><li> Contribute to the development of strategy for each of our business lines in APAC in collaboration with respective business strategy teams and senior stakeholders</li><li> Identify and analyze key strategic partnership, inorganic and investment opportunities for UBS in APAC</li><li> Collaborate effectively with other teams in the Group Strategy Function, as well as Business Leaders, Finance/Controlling, COO and other global management functions on strategic projects and initiatives<br><br></li></ul><strong>Your team<br></strong>As part of the APAC Strategy team based in Hong Kong, you will contribute to the development of UBS’s strategic vision and ambition, and partner with the businesses in driving and operationalizing the key strategic initiatives. Utilizing strong strategic skills, industry experience and functional expertise, the team looks beyond standard solutions to develop new insights, mobilize business strategies, drive tangible results, and position our business even stronger.<br><br>Due to the cross-divisional (Global Wealth Management, Investment Bank, Asset Management) and cross-market (13 jurisdictions in APAC) nature of the team, this role offers wide opportunities for the candidate to learn and experience the diverse businesses and areas across UBS.<br><br><strong>Your expertise<br><br></strong><ul><li> Minimum 4-5 years of experience in management consulting or with a top tier global firm and/or relevant financial services sector experience, with a sound understanding of how a global universal bank operates</li><li> Strategic mindset and understanding of "C-level" agenda and issues</li><li> Excellent analytical skills and problem-solving capabilities (for conceptual, qualitative and quantitative topics)</li><li> Strong communication and presentation skills</li><li> High level of proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel<br><br></li></ul><strong>About Us<br></strong>Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.<br><br>We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?<br><br><strong>Join us<br></strong>We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.<br><br><strong>Disclaimer / Policy Statements<br></strong>UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

jobTitle: HSBC Global Graduate Programme 2022 - Hong Kong & Singapore
jobDescription: Applications for our global graduate programmes in Hong Kong and Singapore are now open.<br><br>You’re excited about starting your career and exploring the many paths and possibilities. We’re a global bank with an inclusive culture and diverse opportunities, spanning all aspects of banking, technology, operations and beyond.<br><br>Whichever path you choose, we offer valuable experiences and learning, with support at every step.<br><br>To read more about each graduate programme and to apply, please click on the programmes listed below. To understand our application and the assessment process, or discover more about a graduate career at HSBC, please visit <strong>hsbc.com/earlycareers<br><br></strong><strong>Hong Kong<br><br></strong>Commercial Banking Graduate Programme<br><br>Markets &amp; Securities Services – Securities Services Graduate Programme<br><br>Markets &amp; Securities Services – Markets Graduate Programme<br><br>Wealth and Personal Banking Graduate Programme<br><br>Asset Management – Investments Graduate Programme<br><br>Asset Management – Alternatives Graduate Programme<br><br>Global Private Banking Graduate Programme<br><br>Global Operations Graduate Programme<br><br>Technology Graduate Programme<br><br><strong>Singapore<br><br></strong>Global Banking – Investment Banking Graduate Programme<br><br>Markets &amp; Securities Services – Markets Graduate Programme<br><br>Final year undergraduate or recent graduate<br><br>You will have obtained or will be working towards a 3.2/4.0 or 4.0/5.0 cumulative GPA or the equivalent of a 2.1 from a recognised University (as appears on your official University transcript or degree certificate). Be fluent in English, however, for Hong Kong programmes, knowledge of Mandarin and/or Cantonese would be an advantage.<br><br>For more information on requirements and application deadline, please refer to <strong>hsbc.com/earlycareers</strong> for details.<br><br><strong>Job Field</strong>: Branch and Retail Banking<br><br><strong>Primary Location</strong>: Asia Pacific-Hong Kong-Hong Kong Island-Central<br><br><strong>Schedule</strong>: Full-time<br><br><strong>Job Posting</strong>: 27-Oct-2021, 14:52:49

<strong>adidas Hong Kong Management Trainee Program<br><br></strong>is to provide the young talents the platform to grow as individuals and as future employees.<br><br>In this program, we offer a unique platform to start your career coached by experienced mentors and managers. You will have the opportunity to rotate within 24 months through different functions of business units, including Brand Activation, Project Management, Retail and eCommerce in Hong Kong. You may also have a rotation opportunity in Shanghai, our Greater China Headquarters, in the last 6 months of the program which helps you develop the multi-cultural career.<br><br><strong>What are we looking for?<br></strong><ul><li>University degree (Bachelor/Master) preferably in Business Administration, Marketing or related disciplines with strong academic record</li><li>Less than 12 months practical experience</li><li>Passion for sports</li><li>Good team player</li><li>Marketing intelligence to the market</li><li>Mobile &amp; international mindset</li><li>Creative, collaborative and confident</li><li>Excellent communications skills in English and Chinese</li><li>Strong in problem-solving and analytical skills</li><li>Strong customer focus<br></li></ul><strong>This exciting program will start in July 2022!</strong>

Job Id: 21390442<br><br>Global Capital Management, as part of BCMA, plays a key role in helping ICG and BCMA management deliver on firms strategic objectives like returns/RoTCE and regulatory/risk management. GCM’s mandate within BCMA is to ensure that all capital commitments to ICG clients are consistent with client relationship strategy, balance sheet and return objectives. The group is responsible for: (i) driving the internal capital approval process which includes aligning relationship stakeholders on client strategy; (ii) planning and implementing the tools, processes and trainings on returns metrics including RoTCE (iii) supporting the client franchise along with Industry to drive critical themes like LIBOR transition and ESG (iv) leading the execution of a variety of BCMA senior management initiatives including Wholesale Credit Review, Concentration Limits, SCO pipeline; and (v) Corporate finance responsibilities for leverage finance portfolio and structuring advisory for complex transactions along with BSCO approvals; vi) being a trusted advisor to Regional Heads, Industry Heads, Risk colleagues at the region and in the country, BCMA heads and bankers in structuring and navigating strategic / BAU transactions.<br><br>The Vice President role in capital management involves both leadership and team work extensively. The primary responsibilities include assessing and recommending approvals for new extensions of capital to Citi clients and guiding PAM teams on efficient use of capital. Additionally, the role entails working on global strategic projects and initiatives that support management stated goals of improvement in RoTCE for the bank and for business groups. This person works closely with Country Corporate Banking teams, Risk Management and Product partners to aid alignment of client strategy and execution. In addition to ensuring efficient capital management:<br><ul><li>Has responsibility for forecasting / monitoring loan growth to ensure the Regional portfolio is managed within the global plan, working closely with the regional Finance team</li><li>Arrange training to banking, risk and product teams on capital developments with a particular focus on TCE and Return on TCE</li><li>Manages quarterly "red zone" approvals</li><li>Focus on public and private side risk mitigation and improve velocity of loan book by bringing efficiencies to the process of mitigation</li><li>Work on strategic global and regional projects to wallet share, revenues, improvement in returns and client value</li><li>Involvement in key projects like LIBOR transition that are transformative for the bank<br></li></ul><strong>Key responsibilities: <br></strong><ul><li>Work with global loan portfolio advisory team to bring more efficiency to risk defeasance and capital optimization (RWA) across the BCMA lending portfolio in Asia</li><li>Ensure a consistent approach to modeling transaction returns across the regional team that is aligned with global practices</li><li>Support capital approval process for the region with approval coverage for various and differing countries over time</li><li>Participate and contribute in the WCR and other remediation projects</li><li>Contribute to development of the BCMA Loan product program</li><li>Continuously stay informed of best practices and market and industry trends</li><li>Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications:<br></u></strong><ul><li>Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication</li><li>Demonstrated planning, negotiation, organizational and analytical skills</li><li>5-8 years of experience, preferably in Corporate Banking Or Product Or Client facing role</li><li>Bachelors Degree, Good to have Masters in Business</li><li>Related lending/credit experience or equivalent product experience</li><li>Demonstrated credit skills, background in credit or first line will be helpful</li><li>Understanding of capital markets products, derivatives, credit, cash management, trade, finance and securities products preferred</li><li>Knowledge of Corporate Banking business including related products, pertinent regulations and the lending and credit approval process<br></li></ul>-------------------------------------------------<br><br><strong>Job Family Group: <br><br></strong>Institutional Banking<br><br>-------------------------------------------------<br><br><strong>Job Family:<br><br></strong>Corporate
